reviews.review:
Play it! There aren't many games out there that rival it's atmosphere and wonder. The gameplay doesn't feel dated and the graphics hold up nicely (just turn off the hd models because they clash with the textures).

The remake is a good game, but this is the better one.
A must be played Classic, just stay away from Source

Even after so many years, its still fun. Even though we have triple-a games, games with life-like graphics, this is still fun to play. Valve, youve kept us waiting for so long with not sign of the 3, and yet, we still love you. You need to #RememberFreeman.
Do I need to say more?
Ace game üëç; buy immediately even without sale immediately if one does not own this game (immediately).

Literally the most groundbreaking game of all time. The guy named Barney hasn't bought me a beer yet, but he saved my life couple of times. Gatekeeper mode on: I don't consider a person as a gamer if they didn't play Half-Life.
The classic to come back to #RememberFreeman

#RememberFreeman

This review serves as a mark of my participation in this event.

I was born in 1997 and this is the one of my first games. Still love every episode including Alyx. It's so cool when you grow with the game, from 3D to VR. I hope there is will be something unique in the future.
Game of the year! :) Great game, finished this 3 times.

It's the game that started it all! The game, Valve, the Steam platform, other awesome Valve titles (exception of that one we don't talk about). It's THE Valve game that made first person shooters great. For it's time the best!

So I'm writting this review to remember this game, remember the one and only FREEMAN.
"We remember the Freeman!" -Vortigaunts from Half-Life 2

#rememberfreeman

this does really hello my gordon.

a true classic in gaming. love replaying it time and again

6.5/10

I love retro games and I played half life ps2 version way back in the day. I hardly remember any of it but I do remember thinking it was groundbreaking even though playing the ps2 version which came out a while after the pc version. somehow, playing through this again just didn't provide me with the same sort of nostalgia I get when i revisit other games. It was a decent game but it's filled with annoyances. Still a good game and as the first "modern day" fps it is a very important game for history but I just don't think it's aged as well as other fps games.
Well worth a playthrough for anyone who's never played it though and I'm in the minority here probably so you might enjoy it a lot more than I did.

I played the Half-life: Day One pre-release demo back in 1998.
To this day, not a year has passed in which I haven't played one or more of the half-life games.

Only rarely have modern shooters come close to the level of immersion and quality set by the original Half-life and all of its successors.

If you haven't played Half-life, then give it a go. It's never too late to discover this game - heck, even after 25 years the gameplay does not feel outdated, the game runs well, and the story is still unrivaled!
Play this game to complete thy life

Let's all raise the bar together
#rememberfreeman
It's a classic what's not to love!
